name: The Brentwood Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know how this is the 6th best hotel in LA as their website (the Brentwood Inn) is completely misleading as there are no "cottages." It's set up like a motel and their website has some very strategic photos to show internet marketing at it's finest.
reviews.title: Not worth it! (Overrated)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked in early and was able to get my room within an hour which was nice and the staff was friendly, but the rooms are nothing special. Basically--it's an expensive motel ($200+/night). The rooms are small and the bathroom is pretty blah as well. The skylight is a bit annoying in the morning especially if you wanted to sleep in. And lastly--the breakfast assortment included muffins, fruit and croissants--once again there is nothing to rave about.
reviews.title: Not sure I agree with the other reviews ....

reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this MOTEL to anyone as it's a rip off .

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and room features for the price

reviews.text: Not sure I agree with the last couple of reviews regarding The Brentwood.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay, great location
Lovely Inn
reviews.text: Sure, the one staff member that spoke to me on check in was very friendly.

I would stay here again. Place is kept clean and staff is more than friendly and knowledgable about surrounding eateries and things to do. If you are a light sleeper it might be too noisy because it's next to the blvd. The only other negative aspect is the skylight. There's no control over the light coming into the skylight on the ceiling. It's annoying in the morning when you're trying to sleep in.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: The Brentwood Inn is an absolute gem. It's nestled in a lovely area along Sunset Boulevard, just a mile west of I-405. The two women working the front office are warm and helpful, as is one of the resident managers who kindly brought an iron to my room at 11:00 one night.
reviews.title: What a gem!
Hospitality Inn
reviews.text: My room was very clean and a winning mix of charm and hi-tech. It was a little on the small side, but laid out to maximize space. Though I think some parts of the room would be too snug for two people. My corner room had a skylight, white shutters as blinds, and furnishings in rich colors. Very home-y. A remote control allows guests to adjust the room's climate.

reviews.title: An enjoyable hotel
reviews.text: The hotel has business travelers in mind, offering free wireless internet, free bottled water, a nice-sized refrigerator, and a desk with a good workspace. Women are also catered to. I appreciated the many useful mirrors and Aveda toiletries, for starters. As a woman traveling alone, I felt secure, even though I usually avoid hotels where rooms open directly onto the parking lot.

reviews.title: Not Bad, But Not The Bel-Air Hotel
reviews.text: The free breakfast of muffins, fruit, and coffee/tea fit the bill. The best part was eating breakfast in the small courtyard edged with a long fountain. You'd never guess busy Sunset Boulevard was on the other side of the tall privacy fence.

reviews.title: Great Experience at The Brentwood
reviews.text: We stayed at The Brentwood for 1 week the 1st part of July. It was a wonderful vacation thanks to the friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the inn. The rooms are small but very updated- track lighting on vaulted wooden ceilings, remote control AC and heat, Aveda products, mini refrigerator with bottled water restocked daily and whenever you need it, and a small but very efficient and relaxing shower! It was like staying in a small trendy cottage in some ways. Parking is free, and it was great to be able to walk outside your room to the car. The landscaping on the grounds is beautiful-take advantage of the patio with cascading wall of water! Muffins, other breakfast pastries, fresh fruit, coffee, and gourmet teas are included- we ate on the patio as often as possible. Our host even packed breakfast bags for us to take on the plane as we were leaving the next day before breakfast!! We also enjoyed walking through the neighborhood each morning- it is about a 15-20 minute walk to the main street, San Vicente, which has lots of shops and restaurants/cafes. Dutton Books is a great place to stop. Our hosts, who are a young couple, and all the staff were very accommodating and gave us lots of good suggestions about things to do and places to go. The J. Paul Getty Center is only about 10 minutes away, too. There is wireless connection and you can also borrow a computer in the office if you didn't bring one. We will certainly return to this great find!

The staff could not have been more accommodating. A small, renovated property in a quiet part of the Brentwood/UCLA area of Los Angeles. The amenities in the room were perfect for my long weekend stay, including a plasma TV! Santa Monica, Venice and Malibu are but a short drive away. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending The Brentwood Inn to anyone needing lodging in this part of LA county.
reviews.title: Under the radar...but fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Brentwood from the 15th May till 20th May. We had a great stay. The Brentwood Inn is situated in a wealthy area of Los Angeles where many stars have their homes. Unfortunately we didn't spot any! We felt safe in the area and were able to walk around at any time of day. The Inn is about a 15 minute walk to the centre of Brentwood where there are shops and restaurants including the Cheesecake Factory. The Brentwood Inn is conviently located to visit the main tourist attractions in LA and is also only a 10 minute drive to Santa Monica.
reviews.title: Great Brentwood

reviews.text: The Brentwood Inn is geared towards the business traveller. The rooms are small but immaculate and with a very modern feel. The owners of the Inn are incredibly helpful and go out their way to answer questions and offer suggestions of things to do. There is a complimentary breakfast which consists of muffins and pastries, tea and coffee.
reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE GEM WITH HEART AND SOUL

reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Brentwood for a month while consulting with a medical specialist in LA. The hotel was recommended by the Doctor who is located in Brentwood. This little gem of an inn is run by an intelligent, charming and entertaining young couple who live on site.
reviews.title: Great location. Terrific owners and staff!

likes.liked: — Location, Value and a great staff.

reviews.title: Overpriced but otherwise ideal
reviews.text: The Inn is a true reflection of it's loving owners. The owners have instilled their values of unending graciousness to the small staff, and there is not an unfriendly face on the premises.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent three nights at the Brentwood Inn recently while we were in town for a wedding. We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel, and a family member recommended the Brentwood. We were thrilled with the hotel's location (minutes from Santa Monica and a beautiful drive up highway 1 to Malibu), clean (though slighly small) rooms, and a fantastically helpful and welcoming staff. We highly recommend it, and will certainly be back ourselves!
reviews.title: Great hotel, Excellent Staff

reviews.title: The Brentwood Inn: A welcome respite.
Can't get your money back if you cancel
reviews.text: We were supposed to stay at the Brentwood Inn on September 23, but my fiance got sick and we had to cancel. The Brentwood Inn would not give us a refund or even let us apply our payment to another night. That cost us more than $200! Be prepared to lose your full payment if you get sick on a Sunday and you don't have a doctor's note to "prove" it.

description: Charm, convenience and extraordinary value: we have it all. Our tastefully decorated rooms are all non-smoking and pet-free, and come equipped with flat-panel LCD TVs and high-speed internet access. Your room rate includes free parking, continental breakfast and freshly-baked cookies every afternoon. Our location in Brentwood is conveniently close to restaurants in Brentwood Village, shopping in Beverly Hills and Santa Monica and only minutes from UCLA and the world-famous Getty Center.
